instruction: Given an Amazon customer review, write a title for the review. The preferred titles are under fifteen words.
input: I had the first generation ipad Mini.  This new model its without a second thought such an upgrade.  The display its amazing, the new processor its super fast.  Regarding the weight...i have not noticed the difference, i understand that its a little more heavy but i have not experience any discomfort when holding it with one hand.  I only hope that they have kept the black color, but the finish and feel of this tablet is amazing.  Thats why i prefer to pay extra.  The quality is amazing and so its the performance.

instruction: Given an Amazon customer review, write a title for the review. The preferred titles are under fifteen words.
input:
They need to invent a KINDLE for the bath! I use mine in the bath all the time. Courtesy Jim Gaffigan!
Seriously - LOVE this product. The only thing I dislike is the web browser and the OS. I am used to all things Apple - so using a android system is a little different and the kindle's keyboard - search function on their web browser SILK is not intuitive and often choses words that I am not typing in auto correct. This leads me to make many mistakes when posting on facebook, internet searching or typing reviews and I often get so frustrated that I often give up on using it for those things and use my Ipad instead. It's great for reading though!

instruction: Given an Amazon customer review, write a title for the review. The preferred titles are under fifteen words.
input: Ordered two of these drives to replace a pair of 150GB Hitachi drives in a RAID 1 configuration. Installation was flawless and the operation is smooth, fast, cool and quiet. instruction: Given an Amazon customer review, write a title for the review. The preferred titles are under fifteen words.
input:
I really like this tablet! It is the 5th one purchased in two years and has NOT (as yet) become a technical nightmare, as have the others, of which only one was purchased via Amazon. The others came from Walmart online purchases.

Arrived on time and well-packaged. A small step above an entry-level Android-based tablet. Go for it!

instruction: Given an Amazon customer review, write a title for the review. The preferred titles are under fifteen words.
input: Like another person explained, this battery worked perfectly in my PS3 controller.  Wires were correct (pos/neg were not crossed).  Original symptoms of battery failure did not come from the controller, but from the PS3 unit saying my USB ports on the PS3 were drawing too much power (Hmm...).  Odd, I had not changed any of my devices in a year. Maybe the USB ports were failing according to some Internet searches (and thus the PS3 was bad... oh my!).  Fortunately, as of now, it seems this was just a symptom of a bad battery in my main PS3 controller (whew!).  Once I replaced the battery with this one I purchased, I no longer got the USB power problem message on the PS3 screen (thank goodness!).  I have all my PS3 devices/controllers attached and a keyboard and all looks good.  This battery seems to work perfectly, yet I cannot of course vouch for its sustainability over time.  I bought 2 batteries just in case this only lasted a few months.  The battery was cheap enough to buy a second one if the lifespan was not so great. I just wanted the controller to work AND make sure my PS3 USB ports were working again without power errors.  Thanks for the great battery!
output: Excellent replacement battery for ps3 controller (ditto)

instruction: Given an Amazon customer review, write a title for the review. The preferred titles are under fifteen words.
input: I actually bought this product from Best Buy (1015PEB-RD601). I upgraded Windows & removed ALL the trial software.  I've had no problems with it.  Battery lasts between 7-9 hrs and takes roughly 1 hour to fully charge it, when its fully drained.  Wifi speeds are great.  This netbook is perfect for everything except gaming (why would you buy a netbook for gaming though? lol).  Despite what others may say about the ASUS Eee PC, I absolutely love this thing. Never had any bad experiences.

instruction: Given an Amazon customer review, write a title for the review. The preferred titles are under fifteen words.
input:
I can't imagine that people are still looking at Apple iPad 1 products but I'll review this anyhow. I thought it was a WONDERFUL case. We have an iPad 2 and the case we have for that one didn't keep the screen from cracking. We own one of the first iPad 1s ever sold. Well, I don't have proof of that but my husband bought it years ago and nobody I knew had ever seen one yet (and we're only 20 miles from San Fran, CA - not living in the middle of nowhere). This case has kept my iPad safe since then. We have several now and I still like my iPad one.

I don't stand it up much because I don't watch TV or movies on it, so I like it for the basic safety function.
output: Nobody will ever read this review

instruction: Given an Amazon customer review, write a title for the review. The preferred titles are under fifteen words.
input: I received this RN 202 unit free from Netgear on the "friends and family program". My whole network is Apple, and the Netgear RN 202 integration is flawless. Setup was a breeze, as most of the other reviewers have stated, and the unit is of a high quality build. The ease of access remotely works well and hasn't failed me yet, with the free RN Remote App in the Apple Store. Files transfer quick remotely also. Basically, remote access and transfer, is what I wanted a NAS for, and this unit works great for that. Overall, great unit for my type of application. Highly recommended!!

instruction: Given an Amazon customer review, write a title for the review. The preferred titles are under fifteen words.
input:
Built products are put together well and use quality materials, which you'd expect because they're expensive. But this bag has problems that make it less than ideal.

I bought this to be a minimal bag, small, slim, and sleek. But it's wider than it needs to be. The straps attach in a way that flairs out of the top of the bag, making it wider than needed. It also makes the bag an odd trapezoid shape.

The second problem is, it's too tight. If your MacBook Air has a slim plastic case (like a Speck case). A Speck case is very thin, yet its little extra size makes it very difficult to get the computer into and out of the Built bag.

Another problem is the bag flap. It's too long. It adds weight. It makes the bag harder to open and close. If you put a computer power cord in the bag's front pockets, then the long flap won't stick and the flap sticks out unattractively.

For me, this bag wasn't worth the high price.
output: Good Quality But Not Useful for Everyone

instruction: Given an Amazon customer review, write a title for the review. The preferred titles are under fifteen words.
input: These won't shake your chair with deafening bass (ha), but they have a very nice sound for low-medium volume listening.  They're extremely light, but that's not a problem since they come with nice rubber pad feet.  The sound is nicely balanced and sounded very natural in piano music, etc. They have decent bass at low volumes, and the highs are not exaggerated, but just about right.  For the price, they're just what I was looking for.
output: For regular low-medium volume listening, very nice
